markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Spiked Chain](/Weapons.aspx?ID=417)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Disarm" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=175" />
<trait label="Finesse" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=179" />
<trait label="Trip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=196" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 278 <sup>2.0</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) All Pathfinder agents have access this weapon_

**Favored Weapon** [Enkaar](/Deities.aspx?ID=657), [Kzininn](/Deities.aspx?ID=667), [Luhar](/Deities.aspx?ID=679), [Nergal](/Deities.aspx?ID=529), [Velgaas](/Deities.aspx?ID=601), [Vorasha](/Deities.aspx?ID=422), [Yhidothrus](/Deities.aspx?ID=441), [Zon-Kuthon](/Deities.aspx?ID=296)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 3 gp

**Damage** 1d8 S

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 2

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Martial

**Group** [Flail](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=7)
</row>

</column>

---

This 4-foot-long length of chain is covered with barbs and has spikes on one or both ends. Some feature metal hoops used as handgrips.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-7" />
name: Spiked Chain
